documents.pageContent:
NeuralVault: Your AI-Powered External Brain

Product Requirements Document v1.0

"We're building the future of human knowledge augmentation - where every piece of information you've ever encountered becomes instantly queryable through natural language."



üöÄ Vision Statement

üöÄ Vision Statement

NeuralVault transforms how humans interact with their digital knowledge. We're creating an AI assistant that doesn't just answer questions - it becomes an extension of your mind, instantly surfacing insights from your entire digital life through conversational AI.

Market Opportunity: The average knowledge worker spends 2.5 hours daily searching for information they already have. We're solving a $2.8T productivity problem.



üéØ Core Value Proposition

üéØ Core Value Proposition

"Ask your life anything, get intelligent answers instantly"

NeuralVault ingests, understands, and connects every piece of your digital information - emails, documents, chats, calendars, bookmarks - creating a unified knowledge graph that responds to natural language queries with unprecedented accuracy and context.



üìä Tiered Feature Requirements

üåü MVP (Months 1-3) - "The Foundation"

Goal: Prove core value with 1,000 power users

Core Engine

Core Engine

Personal document ingestion (PDF, DOCX, TXT, MD)

Vector embedding pipeline using OpenAI text-embedding-ada-002

Basic RAG implementation with ChromaDB

Simple chat interface with memory

Gmail integration via MCP server

Success Metrics

90% query relevance score

<3 second response time

80% user retention after 7 days

Process 10K+ documents per user

Technical Stack

LangChain for orchestration

ChromaDB for vector storage

FastAPI backend with WebSocket support

FastAPI backend with WebSocket support

React frontend with real-time updates



üöÄ Growth (Months 4-8) - "The Multiplier"

Goal: Scale to 10K users, $50K MRR

Advanced Intelligence

Multi-modal RAG (text, images, PDFs with tables)

Contextual conversation threading

Proactive insights and notifications

Advanced query understanding with intent detection

Integration Ecosystem

Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive via MCP servers

Slack, Discord, Teams message history

Slack, Discord, Teams message history

Calendar integration with meeting transcripts

Browser extension for bookmark/article capture

Enterprise Features

Team knowledge sharing with permission controls

API access for third-party integrations

Custom embedding models for domain-specific content

Advanced analytics and usage insights

Success Metrics

$4 ARPU (Average Revenue Per User)

95% query satisfaction rate

40% month-over-month growth

<1% churn rate

40% month-over-month growth

<1% churn rate



üåç Scale (Months 9-18) - "The Platform"

Goal: 100K users, Series A funding, $2M ARR

AI Sophistication

Multi-agent orchestration for complex queries

Real-time learning from user feedback

Predictive information surfacing

Cross-user knowledge insights (privacy-preserved)

Platform Expansion

Mobile apps (iOS/Android) with offline capability

Voice interface with natural speech processing

Collaborative workspaces and shared knowledge bases

White-label enterprise solutions

Advanced Integrations

CRM systems (Salesforce, HubSpot)

Project management tools (Notion, Asana, Linear)

Code repositories (GitHub, GitLab)

Financial platforms (banking, investment accounts)

AI Infrastructure

Custom fine-tuned models for personal data

Federated learning across user base

Advanced reasoning with graph neural networks

Multi-language support with 20+ languages

Success Metrics

$20 ARPU for enterprise customers

98% uptime SLA

98% uptime SLA

60% of queries answered without human input needed

500K+ API calls daily



üèó Technical Architecture

Core Components

1. Ingestion Pipeline

Real-time document processing with change detection

Intelligent chunking based on document structure

Metadata extraction and tagging

Deduplication and version control

2. Vector Intelligence

Hybrid search (semantic + keyword)

Dynamic re-ranking based on user behavior

Temporal relevance scoring

Cross-reference relationship mapping

Cross-reference relationship mapping

3. MCP Server Ecosystem

Standardized connectors for 50+ data sources

Real-time synchronization with webhook support

Rate limiting and error handling

OAuth2 security with token refresh

4. Conversational AI

Context-aware response generation

Multi-turn conversation memory

Citation and source attribution

Confidence scoring and uncertainty handling



üí∞ Business Model

Pricing Tiers

Personal ($19/month)

100GB storage, 1K queries/month

100GB storage, 1K queries/month

Basic integrations (email, drive, calendar)

Standard AI models

Professional ($49/month)

1TB storage, 10K queries/month

All integrations + API access

Advanced AI models + custom training

Enterprise ($199/user/month)

Unlimited storage and queries

White-label deployment

Dedicated support + SLA

Custom model development

Revenue Projections

Year 1: $500K ARR (2.5K users avg)

Year 2: $5M ARR (15K users avg)

Year 3: $25M ARR (60K users avg)

Year 3: $25M ARR (60K users avg)



üé™ Competitive Advantage

1. Privacy-First Architecture

Local-first with cloud sync options

End-to-end encryption

User-controlled data retention

GDPR/CCPA compliance by design

2. Universal Integration

MCP protocol enables any data source

No vendor lock-in

Cross-platform compatibility

Open-source connector ecosystem

3. Contextual Intelligence

Understands temporal relationships

Maps information hierarchies

Learns personal preferences

Learns personal preferences

Predicts information needs



üö¶ Success Criteria & KPIs

Product-Market Fit Indicators

40%+ of users active daily

Net Promoter Score >50

Organic growth rate >30% monthly

Average session duration >10 minutes

Technical Excellence

99.9% uptime

<2 second query response time

95%+ query relevance score

Zero data breaches

Business Milestones

$1M ARR within 18 months

Series A funding ($10M+)

100K registered users

Series A funding ($10M+)

100K registered users

Strategic partnerships with 3+ major platforms



üîÆ Future Vision 

The Ultimate Goal: NeuralVault becomes the universal interface between humans and all digital information, powering a new era of augmented intelligence where the boundary between human memory and digital knowledge disappears.

Moonshot Features:

Brain-computer interface integration

Holographic knowledge visualization

Predictive information delivery

Predictive information delivery

Universal knowledge graph across all human information



"We're not just building a chatbot. We're creating the next evolution of human intelligence."

Sheet: PEP
Date	Statement of Problem	Output	Category	Host
45852	Classify movie reviews as positive, neutral or negative in a valid JSON.

Statement of Problem:Write a prompt that instructs ChatGPT to act as a patient, knowledgeable Technical Support Engineer, helping a new developer troubleshoot why their deployed app isn‚Äôt showing updates after pushing new code.
 User Query:I deployed my app to the cloud, but even after pushing new code to GitHub, my website isn‚Äôt updating. What could be wrong?		Role based and Constraint	
45856	DAY 5 -

45856	DAY 5 -
Statement of Problem:Write a prompt that instructs ChatGPT to respond like a career counselor who‚Äôs advising a confused graduate who studied engineering but is now considering a switch to design or entrepreneurship.
User Query:- I graduated with an engineering degree, but I don‚Äôt think I want to be an engineer. I‚Äôve been thinking about design or even starting something of my own. I feel lost. What should I do?‚Äù		Role based and Constraint	
45859	DAY 6 -

45859	DAY 6 -
Write a prompt that instructs ChatGPT to explain event delegation step by step for beginners.
Include: event bubbling, why it‚Äôs useful, a div handling button clicks, and how event.target finds the clicked button.		Chain of thought Reasoning	Sankar
45860	```
Day 7 :

Write a prompt that asks ChatGPT to solve the following logic puzzle using step-by-step reasoning:

> "Only the person who lies took the apple.
> Alice said she didn't take it.
> Bob said Alice did.
> Carol said Bob is lying."

```		Chain of thought Reasoning	Sankar
45861	DAY 8 -
Write a prompt that instructs ChatGPT to explain why the following number is a prime number, step by step.

User Query:
"Why is 17 a prime number?"		Chain of thought Reasoning	Sankar
45866	üó£Ô∏è Prompting Exercise: Giving Constructive Feedback to a Peer
üìù Statement of Problem:
A junior team member needs to give feedback to a colleague whose recent work was sloppy and missed key requirements. However, their original message comes off as blunt and slightly confrontational, which may strain the team dynamic.

Your task is to write a prompt that instructs an AI assistant to rewrite the message into a constructive, respectful, and collaborative piece of feedback.

üß† Your Prompt Should Guide the AI to:

- Use language (‚ÄúWe noticed‚Ä¶‚Äù vs. ‚ÄúYou did wrong‚Ä¶‚Äù)
- Without blame
- .................. Use your creativity

üí¨ Original Feedback (from the team member):
This isn‚Äôt right. You missed a bunch of things in the spec, and now we have to redo part of it. Please check more carefully next time.		Writing Formal Letter	Sanjeev
45868	# Statement of Problem:
A junior employee has written an apology email to a client after a product release introduced bugs that disrupted the client‚Äôs service. The message is overly casual, lacks ownership, and doesn‚Äôt offer concrete next steps.

You need to write a prompt that guides an AI assistant to transform this email into a professional, client-appropriate version.

The rewritten version should rebuild trust while being respectful and clear ‚Äî but it's up to you to figure out exactly what tone, structure, and content the AI should focus on. Some of the example instructions you might include in your prompt:-

-Express genuine accountability without blaming others or sounding panicked
-Briefly summarize what went wrong (non-technically)
-Offer a follow-up meeting or support if needed
Use your Creativity don't just include above instructions...

# Original Email
Hi,  We‚Äôre really sorry the release didn‚Äôt go well. There were a few bugs we didn‚Äôt catch, and some users couldn‚Äôt access the dashboard. We‚Äôre fixing it now and it should be okay soon. Let us know if there‚Äôs anything else you need.
		Writing Formal Letter	Sanjeev
45869	Todays Technique:- Researched Based Prompting

Research On:-
Should you commit package-lock.json to version control? Or should it be added to .gitignore?		Research Based Prompting	Sanjeev
45870	Research and compare Vanilla JavaScript and React for building modern web applications. Debate which approach is more suitable for different types of projects, considering factors like performance, development speed, maintainability, scalability, and learning curve.
		Research Based Prompting	Sanjeev

Research Based Prompting	Sanjeev
45873	Classify message sentiment as Positive or Negative

Input:  You are a great human 
Response from chatgpt:
Negative		Few Shot Prompting	Anish
45874	Problem: How to increase the website traffic by 50% in 3 months?		Research Based Prompting	Ganesh
45875

45875	
 Question: John‚Äôs wedding anniversary is on Wednesday, August 6, 2025. In which years will the date and day match exactly as they did on his wedding day? Provide the next 2 upcoming years. 		ReACT Based Prompting	Anu

45876	‚ÄúWrite down a real tragic or very sad moment from your life. Spill as many details as you want ‚Äî don‚Äôt hold back. Then, use ChatGPT to turn that moment into a hilarious, savage, 100-word comedy story. The goal: make it so funny your squad can‚Äôt stop laughing, but it still connects to your original story.‚Äù		Transformative Story telling Prompting | Tone Shift Prompting	Swikar

45877	Topic: Consistent Character Prompting Task: Write 6 to 7 detailed AI image prompts depicting the same character in different scenes. Ensure that the core character description remains exactly the same in every prompt, while only the setting, action, or environment changes.		Consistent Character prompting	Ashok
45880	## Active prompting

45880	## Active prompting 
A couple born in different years, share same birthday. They got married on their shared birthday when the groom turned 22. Now, on their 30th wedding anniversary, their combined age is exactly 5times the groom‚Äôs age at the time of their wedding.
## Your task: Write a clear, well-structured prompt that would allow an AI to figure out how old the bride was when they got married.		Active Prompting	Anjana
45881	Exercise ‚Äì Context Expansion for Full-Stack Development

Task:
Below is a vague prompt. Your job is to rewrite it so that it provides enough relevant context for an AI to produce a high-quality, tailored output. Make sure to specify audience, purpose, scope, technology stack, and format.

Vague Prompt: "Teach me how to make a web app."		 Context Expansion	Shankar
45882	‚ÄúWrite about the importance of technology in Nepal.‚Äù		Directional Stimulus Prompting	Binita
45883	"Write a guide for first-time travellers to Paris."	Not the output but the Master Prompt for these types of question

[Step 0: Task Definition]
You are a travel expert tasked with writing a guide for first-time travelers visiting Paris, France. Your goal is to generate a 500-word guide for readers unfamiliar with international travel.

[Step 1: Context Enrichment]
Include background about Paris landmarks, local transportation, dining, and cultural etiquette.

[Step 2: Missing Context Detection]
Identify any missing details, such as intended travel season, budget level, or specific interests of the travelers.

[Step 3: Context Mismatch Correction]
Confirm the guide focuses solely on Paris, France, not Paris, Texas, or other locations. Keep all information relevant to first-time travelers.

[Step 4: Verification]
Summarize your understanding of the task and context before writing.

[Step 5: Output Generation]
Produce the 500-word travel guide in a friendly and informative tone, with headings for landmarks, transportation, and dining tips.	Context Mismatch Prompting	Lokesh
45887	Task: Identify what context is missing and rewrite the prompt to make it clear and specific.

Prompt: Write a summary about technology.		Missing Context Detection	Mahesh
45888	Context Layering
task: write a essay on any topic	 Twmplate
# Layer 1 ‚Äì Role & Identity
You are [ROLE].

# Layer 1 ‚Äì Role & Identity
You are [ROLE].  
(Example: "You are a senior software engineer with 10 years of experience in Python backend systems.")

# Layer 2 ‚Äì Background / Context
[Provide necessary context for the task.]  
(Example: "I am working on a Flask app that uses SQLite for storing attendance data.")

# Layer 3 ‚Äì Task Definition
Your task is to [TASK].  
(Example: "Your task is to write optimized Python code for inserting face embeddings into SQLite.")

# Layer 4 ‚Äì Constraints & Style
- [Constraint 1]  
- [Constraint 2]  
(Example: "- Code must follow PEP8. - Keep it under 40 lines. - Add inline comments.")

# Layer 5 ‚Äì Examples / Output Format
[Show example or specify structure.]  
(Example: "Output should be a single code block with explanation after it.")	Context Layering	Manoj

Sheet: PEP-ProvideContext
Category: Context Enrichment in Prompt Engineering
This skill focuses on supplying enough relevant background information so the AI can produce accurate, useful, and appropriately tailored responses. 
It‚Äôs about ensuring the AI understands why and for whom the task is being done, not just what the task is. 
Without context, answers may be generic, vague, or mismatched to your needs.
Exercise 1 ‚Äì Context Expansion

Exercise 1 ‚Äì Context Expansion
Task: Rewrite this vague prompt to include enough background for a more useful answer:
"Write me a report about climate change."
Your rewritten version should clarify:
Audience (e.g., high school students, policymakers)
Purpose (e.g., to inform, persuade, summarize latest research)
Length and style (e.g., 2 pages, formal tone, bullet points allowed)
Any data sources or timeframes to focus on.
Exercise 2 ‚Äì Missing Context Detection
Read this prompt:

Read this prompt:
"Give me tips for improving productivity."
Identify three pieces of context missing from this request that would make the answer more targeted. Then, rewrite it with those details.
Exercise 3 ‚Äì Context Layering
Start with a very basic prompt:
"Explain gravity."
Now create three progressively richer versions:
Add audience context (e.g., for a 10-year-old child).
Add purpose context (e.g., for a school science fair speech).

Add constraints (e.g., use analogies involving sports and limit to 150 words).
Exercise 4 ‚Äì Context Mismatch Correction
Here‚Äôs a prompt with context that doesn‚Äôt fit:
"Write a social media post about a new medical device using casual teen slang." (Audience: heart surgeons)
Identify the mismatch and rewrite the context so the tone, audience, and purpose align.
Exercise 5 ‚Äì Context Inference Practice
Given a task description:

Given a task description:
"Summarize the following 20-page market research report on electric vehicles."
Write three questions you would ask the requester to get the missing context before you start.

# Machine Learning Fundamentals

## Introduction

Machine Learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and make decisions without being explicitly programmed.

## Types of Machine Learning

### 1. Supervised Learning

- **Definition**: Learning from labeled training data
- **Examples**: Classification, Regression
- **Algorithms**: Linear Regression, Random Forest, Neural Networks

### 2. Unsupervised Learning

### 2. Unsupervised Learning

- **Definition**: Finding patterns in unlabeled data
- **Examples**: Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction
- **Algorithms**: K-means, PCA, Autoencoders

### 3. Reinforcement Learning

- **Definition**: Learning through interaction with environment
- **Examples**: Game playing, Robotics
- **Algorithms**: Q-Learning, Deep Q-Networks

## Key Concepts

### Feature Engineering

## Key Concepts

### Feature Engineering

The process of selecting and transforming raw data into features that can be used by machine learning algorithms.

### Model Evaluation

- **Accuracy**: Percentage of correct predictions
- **Precision**: True positives / (True positives + False positives)
- **Recall**: True positives / (True positives + False negatives)
- **F1-Score**: Harmonic mean of precision and recall

### Overfitting vs Underfitting

### Overfitting vs Underfitting

- **Overfitting**: Model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
- **Underfitting**: Model performs poorly on both training and new data

## Best Practices

1. Always split data into training, validation, and test sets
2. Use cross-validation for robust model evaluation
3. Regularize models to prevent overfitting
4. Feature scaling for algorithms sensitive to scale
5. Handle missing data appropriately

LangChain Framework Overview

LangChain is a powerful framework for developing applications powered by language models. It provides a comprehensive set of tools and abstractions that make it easier to build complex AI applications.

Key Features:
- Document Loading: Support for various document formats (PDF, DOCX, TXT, etc.)
- Text Splitting: Intelligent text chunking for optimal processing
- Vector Storage: Integration with various vector databases

- Retrieval: Advanced document retrieval and search capabilities
- Chat Models: Easy integration with various LLM providers
- Memory: Conversation memory and context management
- Agents: Autonomous agents that can perform complex tasks

Use Cases:
1. Document Q&A: Ask questions about your documents
2. Chatbots: Build intelligent conversational agents
3. Data Analysis: Analyze and extract insights from documents
4. Content Generation: Generate content based on your data

5. Research Assistant: Help with research and information gathering

The framework is designed to be modular and extensible, allowing developers to build custom solutions for their specific needs.

TEJ Fellowship - Teaching Fellow Guide & Student Profiles
1. Role Context
Position: Teaching Fellow (Associate Instructor) at T.E.J. Center
Mission: Act as expert advisor and mentor supporting full-stack coding bootcamp students (TEJ
Fellows) both technically and personally.
2. Teaching Fellow Responsibilities
- Support full-time coding bootcamp students (TEJ Fellows) both technically and personally
- Assist with daily lessons, labs, and technical workshops

- Facilitate group learning and code reviews with detailed, actionable feedback
- Guide students through debugging and writing clean, production-quality code
- Participate in retrospectives and curriculum improvement efforts
3. Core Values to Uphold
- Equity: Support inclusive, accessible, barrier-free learning for all students
- Excellence: Maintain high standards in mentorship, code quality, and pedagogy
- Empathy: Foster patient, student-centered guidance and emotional support

- Integrity: Model honesty, professionalism, and accountability

Total Fellows: 13 students

- Diversity of backgrounds (technical, geographic, academic)

All Fellows have agreed to follow these policies:
Academic & Professional Standards
- Time Commitment: Full-time commitment to TEJ Fellowship from start to finish

- Attendance: Maintain at least 95% attendance; be punctual and prepared
- Participation: Actively participate in all workshops, assignments, activities, and assessments
- Academic Integrity: Submit only your own work; avoid cheating or plagiarism

Career Development
- Course Timeline: TEJ Fellowship may modify course completion timelines as needed
- Job Applications: Focus fully on learning until Senior Phase; avoid job applications before then
Community & Conduct
- Respectful Environment: Contribute to safe, respectful, and inclusive learning space
- Professional Conduct: Behave respectfully at TEJ Fellowship and community events
- Campus Care: Respect campus property; clean up after yourself

- Legal Compliance: Do not engage in illegal activities using TEJ Fellowship resources
Support & Responsibility
- Personal Responsibility: Understand personal liability for violations
- Seeking Support: Ask for help when needed‚Äîtechnical or personal
- Health Maintenance: Strive to maintain good physical and mental health
8. Teaching Philosophy & Approach
Mentorship Guidelines
- Empathetic & Encouraging: Maintain supportive, professional tone

- Personalized: Use student names and relevant background details
- Actionable: Provide specific, step-by-step suggestions
- Holistic: Support both technical growth and soft skills development
Core Teaching Principles
- Grounded in Real-World Experience: Bootcamp-style teaching methodology
- Full-Stack JavaScript Focus: Aligned with clean code principles and Agile practices
- Equity-Centered: Ensure inclusive, accessible learning for all students

- Growth-Oriented: Foster continuous improvement and resilience
Areas of Focus
- Technical Skills: Coding, debugging, code reviews
- Soft Skills: Communication, empathy, student motivation
- Project-Based Learning: Hands-on, practical application
- Career Preparation: Industry-relevant skills and professional development
9. Key Strategies for Hungry Coders Success
Individual Development Plans
- Hari Shankar (Ashok): Focus on digital agency preparation, entrepreneurship skills

- Binita: Build confidence in technical discussions, accessibility-focused projects
- Anjana: Strengthen time management, combine creative interests with coding
- Swikar: Leverage teaching background, develop remote work skills

- Lokesh: Integrate GIS expertise with software development, overcome introversion
Group Dynamics
- Diverse Backgrounds: Leverage varied engineering disciplines
- Peer Learning: Facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration
- Inclusive Environment: Address different confidence levels and communication styles
- Project Collaboration: Create opportunities for cross-skill learning
Assessment & Feedback
- Regular Check-ins: Personal touchpoints with each student

- Code Reviews: Detailed, actionable feedback on technical work
- Retrospectives: Weekly group reflection and improvement planning
- Progress Tracking: Monitor both technical and soft skill development
This document serves as a comprehensive guide for supporting the Hungry Coders learning group
within the broader cohort at TEJ Fellowship.
